alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Harding County; Northeast Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 24 at 1:30PM MST until January 26 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 7 inches possible, except between 8 and 12 inches across the southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHERE...East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Eastern San Miguel County, Far Northeast Highlands, Harding County and Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes portions of I-25 between Glorieta, Las Vegas and Raton.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Harding County; Northeast Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
